subject: Photography
title: Why Black and White Still Matters
description: A quick win: understand Why Black and White Still Matters.

hook.text: Color photography has existed for over a century. Yet black and white refuses to die. Why?

buildup.text: Black and white strips a scene to its essential elements: light, shadow, form, texture, and emotion.

discovery.text: Without color to distract, composition becomes primary. Lines, shapes, and contrast carry the entire image.

twist.text: Black and white isn't the absence of color ‚Äî it's the deliberate removal of it to reveal something deeper.

punchline.text: Remove color and you see what's really there.

quiz.question: Why does black and white photography remain relevant?
options: It strips images to essential elements like light, shadow, and form
